title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 504.6 - Interest eligibility and computation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 504.6 - Interest eligibility and computation

State Regulations

If the authority fails to make prompt payment, the authority
shall pay interest to a contractor on the payment when such interest computed
as provided herein is equal to or more than $10. Interest shall be computed at
the daily rate in effect on the date of payment, as set by the New York State

Tax Commission for corporate taxes pursuant to section
1096 (e)(1)
of the Tax

Law. Interest on such a payment shall be computed for the period beginning on
the day after the payment due date and ending on the date of
payment. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
504.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
